result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel A Novotny

10:38 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Defendant Daniel A Novotny in court.  Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler in court for Daniel A Novotny. 
Atty Bihler requests further discovery and requests an offer in this matter. 
State has no offer in the file
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:10 PM Defendant Daniel A Novotny in court.  Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler in court for Daniel A Novotny.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
State files amended complaint. 
Defense accepts amended complaint, waives reading and enters not guilty plea. 
Atty Bihler requests more time. 
State does not object.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel A Novotny
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-10-2022)
Prior: S15 W22262 Arcadian Ave, Waukesha, WI 53186

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. 
The firearms taken by Witness A are to be turned into the Waukesha Sheriff's Department by close of business on Friday, August 12, 2022.

1:37 PM Defendant Daniel A Novotny in court, in custody with attorney Doug Bihler. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bihler states they have an objection to the complaint.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Attorney Bihler presents arguments challenging the four corners of the criminal complaint.  State presents arguments in support of the Criminal Complaint.  Court places findings on the record and does find probable cause but does not find probable cause as to the use of a dangerous weapon enhancer.  Court strikes the dangerous weapon enhancer.  Attorney Bihler does not wish to enter a plea today prior to having a conversation with his client based upon the Court's ruling.  The Court finds probable cause and enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Court conducts colloquy with Witness A in regards to the contact order and firearms in the residence.  The firearms taken by Witness A are to be turned into the Waukesha Sheriff's Department by close of business on Friday, August 12, 2022.  The Court will not put any no contact order in place for Witness A.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
WCS Pre-trial Report
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
